sentences.sContent: I wore sunglasses all the time and people thought it was an affectation.
sentences.sCn: 我一直戴着墨镜，别人认为是做作。

words.tran: 受到影响的；做作的；假装的
影响；假装；使…感动（affect的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranCn: 假装, 虚饰, 做作
trans.tranOther: If you say that someone's attitude or behaviour is an affectation, you disapprove of the fact that it is not genuine or natural, but is intended to impress other people
